newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain budget won't fund loss-making state firms.
newsitem.headline: Spain budget won't fund loss-making state firms.

text.p: The Spanish government said on Tuesday that it would no longer finance loss-making state-owned companies through the budget, but instead in 1997 would use funds from profitable state-owned groups and from the Treasury.
Funds required to finance these companies total 325 billion pesetas, Industry Minister Josep Pique said.
"This isn't a cut. It means that (the funds) aren't going to come from the budget," Pique told journalists.

Of the 325 billion pesetas, 200 billion will come from the profits or the privatisation earnings of profitable state-owned companies. The remaining 125 billion pesetas will be financed through the Treasury, Pique said.
